abstract: Federal Communications Commission announces it will fine AT&T Mobility $100 million, accusing firm of misleading millions of wireless customers with unlimited data plans by slowing down their service after they had used a certain amount of data, without informing them; is first time that FCC has accused a company of violating rule requiring consumer disclosure, and is largest fine ever levied by the agency.
lead_paragraph: The commission said the wireless carrier misled consumers with unlimited data plans when it slowed their service after they had used a certain amount of data.

headline.main: F.C.C. to Fine AT&T for Slowing Data Speeds of Some Customers
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Will Fine AT&T for Slowing Data Speed for Some Users

snippet: The commission said the wireless carrier misled consumers with unlimited data plans when it slowed their service after they had used a certain amount of data.
